briefdescription.para: Get world space position of point.
Total number of points in the path (anchors and controls)
Number of anchor points making up the path.
Number of bezier curves making up this path.

detaileddescription.para: Path can exist in 3D (xyz), 2D (xy), or Top-Down (xz) space In xy or xz space, points will be clamped to that plane (so in a 2D path, for example, points will always be at 0 on z axis)

briefdescription.para: If closed, path will loop back from end point to start point.

detaileddescription.para: The control mode determines the behaviour of control points. Possible modes are: Aligned = controls stay in straight line around their anchor Mirrored = controls stay in straight, equidistant line around their anchor Free = no constraints (use this if sharp corners are needed) Automatic = controls placed automatically to try make the path smooth

briefdescription.para: When using automatic control point placement, this value scales how far apart controls are placed.
Flip the normal vectors 180 degrees.
Global angle that all normal vectors are rotated by (only relevant for paths in 3D space)
Bounding box containing the path.
Creates a two-anchor path centred around the given centre point.

detaileddescription.para: param name="isClosed"> Should the end point connect back to the start point?
param name="space"> Determines if the path is in 3d space, or clamped to the xy/xz plane

memberdef.argsstring: (IEnumerable< Vector3 > points, bool isClosed=false, PathSpace space=PathSpace.xyz)
memberdef.name: BezierPath

briefdescription.para: Creates a path from the supplied 3D points.

detaileddescription.para: param name="points"> List or array of points to create the path from.
param name="isClosed"> Should the end point connect back to the start point?
param name="space"> Determines if the path is in 3d space, or clamped to the xy/xz plane

memberdef.argsstring: (IEnumerable< Vector2 > transforms, bool isClosed=false, PathSpace space=PathSpace.xy)
memberdef.name: BezierPath

briefdescription.para: Creates a path from the positions of the supplied 2D points.

detaileddescription.para: param name="transforms"> List or array of transforms to create the path from.
param name="isClosed"> Should the end point connect back to the start point?
param name="space"> Determines if the path is in 3d space, or clamped to the xy/xz plane

memberdef.argsstring: (IEnumerable< Transform > transforms, bool isClosed=false, PathSpace space=PathSpace.xy)
memberdef.name: BezierPath

briefdescription.para: Creates a path from the positions of the supplied transforms.

detaileddescription.para: param name="transforms"> List or array of transforms to create the path from.
param name="isClosed"> Should the end point connect back to the start point?
param name="space"> Determines if the path is in 3d space, or clamped to the xy/xz plane

memberdef.argsstring: (IEnumerable< Vector2 > points, PathSpace space=PathSpace.xyz, bool isClosed=false)
memberdef.name: BezierPath

briefdescription.para: Creates a path from the supplied 2D points.

detaileddescription.para: param name="points"> List or array of 2d points to create the path from.
param name="isClosed"> Should the end point connect back to the start point?
param name="pathSpace"> Determines if the path is in 3d space, or clamped to the xy/xz plane

briefdescription.para: Get world space position of point.
Get world space position of point.
Add new anchor point to end of the path.
Add new anchor point to start of the path.
Insert new anchor point at given position. Automatically place control points around it so as to keep shape of curve the same.
Delete the anchor point at given index, as well as its associated control points.
Returns an array of the 4 points making up the segment (anchor1, control1, control2, anchor2)
Move an existing point to a new position.
Update the bounding box of the path.
Get the desired angle of the normal vector at a particular anchor (only relevant for paths in 3D space)
Set the desired angle of the normal vector at a particular anchor (only relevant for paths in 3D space)
Reset global and anchor normal angles to 0.
Update the bounding box of the path.
Determines good positions (for a smooth path) for the control points affected by a moved/inserted anchor point.
Determines good positions (for a smooth path) for all control points.
Calculates good positions (to result in smooth path) for the controls around specified anchor.
Determines good positions (for a smooth path) for the control points at the start and end of a path.

detaileddescription.para: Update point positions for new path space (for example, if changing from xy to xz path, y and z axes will be swapped so the path keeps its shape in the new space)

briefdescription.para: Add/remove the extra 2 controls required for a closed path.
Loop index around to start/end of points array if out of bounds (useful when working with closed paths)

detaileddescription.para: A bezier path is a path made by stitching together any number of (cubic) bezier curves. A single cubic bezier curve is defined by 4 points: anchor1, control1, control2, anchor2 The curve moves between the 2 anchors, and the shape of the curve is affected by the positions of the 2 control points When two curves are stitched together, they share an anchor point (end anchor of curve 1 = start anchor of curve 2). So while one curve alone consists of 4 points, two curves are defined by 7 unique points. Apart from storing the points, this class also provides methods for working with the path. For example, adding, inserting, and deleting points.
